abstract: National Park Service recognizes contribution of Italian immigrant and chief carver Luigi Del Bianco to creation of Mount Rushmore national monument, effort that has long been overlooked.

headline.print_headline: 75 Years Later, Honoring the Man Who Put Faces on Mount Rushmore
headline.main: An Immigrant’s Contribution to Mount Rushmore Is Recognized, 75 Years Later

snippet: Luigi Del Bianco, an Italian immigrant who settled in New York, was the chief carver of the monument, which the National Park Service recently acknowledged after a long effort by his family.
lead_paragraph: Luigi Del Bianco, an Italian immigrant who settled in New York, was the chief carver of the monument, which the National Park Service recently acknowledged after a long effort by his family.
